title: Why don’t I like modern music? - Quora

response.answer_text: No idea. You don’t have to like modern music. It’s not mandatory. It’s not mandatory to only like classic rock, or 40’s country, or early disco, or jump blues. It’s not mandatory to like music from any decade, any period, any generation. There’s no such thing as music that’s too ancient for youth to listen to, or being too old to listen to new music. There’s just music. Whether it be made by banging rocks together or clicking around a computer, it all takes ability, talent, knowledge and practice. The one thing about all music is you don’t have to like it and you should never be apologetic for liking what you like. And there’s so much music out there, so much variety from every age and all over the world that you’re going to find something to like. And probably, something you don’t like. If it so happens that it’s ‘modern music’, which is a term that relates only to calendars, then that’s that and it’s a little bit of a shame, but it ain’t no big deal.

My personal theory is “If I don’t like a particular genre of music, I just haven’t listened to it enough.” This worked for me for Country Music, Bag Pipe and Balkan. If you really want to appreciate it, listen to a lot of it. That being said there is no requirement that you like modern music. You could live a long satisfying life by ignoring it
